Text: Anyone beliving that human life is worth more than what they spend as a consumer?
Assuming that human life is worth more than what you spend as a consumer (disregarding any difficulties entailed by such a calculation), what has that got to do with joining a religion?

When a cult becomes mainstream, people start calling it a "religion". All "religions" are cults because they all expect you to throw reason and logic aside, and "just have faith".  Thanks for the torrent.
Cults / religions are like Football teams- Its even kicks off between supporters - Bring it on~!

"what has that got to do with joining a religion?"

The only ones "subhuman enough" to find the faith are those who realise that a life is far more than just producing and spending.
Hence people with strictly materialistic and/or economic values will not belive in the spiritual forces surrounding all religions.

What about those "who realise that a life is far more than just producing and spending" AND spiritual forces, and who also realize that the dichotomy between bad materialism and good spiritualism (= if you haven't got religion you're an evil & simpleminded materialist who don't think, except about money) is a piece of religious propaganda?
And: if there are such things as spiritual forces, why would they limit themselves to surrounding religions? (Just a thought: if it really is so, could it be because the general lack of spirit in religion -- something like a spiritual vacuum -- is kept up by excluding all spirit, that is by keeping it outside, in its surroundings?)
Self-delusional crap, plain and simple.  But thanks for sharing - it might provide a good laugh or two.

Cool!

THNX for the Download and keep it up!
